business.headline: Muhurat Trading 2024 LIVE: Sensex, Nifty trade higher at pre-openMuhurat Trading 2024 is set to kick off shortly, welcoming Samvat 2081 with a special one-hour session from 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM on November 1. The pre-opening data shows a strong start, with the Sensex and Nifty gaining sharply. This special session, steeped in tradition, marks the Hindu New Year and invites investors to make token investments as a gesture for prosperity in the coming year. With all intraday positions squared off 15 minutes before close, traders are planning carefully for this symbolic and strategic event.

Muhurat Trading 2024: Check timings, stock recommendations, all key detailsMuhurat Trading today: The pre-opening session will begin at 5:45 PM, and all intraday positions will be automatically squared off 15 minutes before the session's close, necessitating careful planning for same-day trades.

Muhurat trading 2024: Check stock picks, trading strategy and expert insightsMuhurat trading is not just a unique market session; it's a cherished tradition where investors make token investments to invoke the blessings of Goddess Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth.

Bibek Debroy dies at 69: A visionary economist and policy reformer Bibek Debroy's life was marked by significant contributions to economic policy and classical literature, shaping India's intellectual landscape and leaving a lasting impact on future generations.

19 kg LPG commercial cylinders to get costlier from today. Check pricesThe prices of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinders have been revised across the country, including in metro cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Chennai, effective November 1.

Sensex ends over 550 points lower, Nifty dips as IT stocks slideThe S&P BSE Sensex dropped by 553.12 points to close at 79,389.06, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 135.50 points, settling at 24,205.35. Broader market indices also declined as volatility weighed on investor sentiment across Dalal Street.

Explained: Why Cipla share price surged up to 10% todayCipla share price: The stock rose by 9.88% to reach a day high of Rs 1,557.45 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).  At 10:41 am, shares of Cipla were up 8.24% at Rs 1,534.25.

HDFC Bank's HDB Financial files Rs 12,500 crore IPO. Check detailsHDFC Bank, holding a 94.6% stake in HDB Financial, will sell shares worth up to Rs 10,000 crore, while HDB Financial plans to issue fresh shares totalling Rs 2,500 crore, as outlined in the filing.
Diwali fireworks missing from Dalal Street as Sensex, Nifty fall The S&P BSE Sensex was down 199.13 points to 79,743.05 at 10:07 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 126 points to 24,340.85.

Paytm lights up Noida skies with dazzling Diwali drone showPaytm celebrated Diwali with a dazzling drone show at its Noida headquarters, featuring messages like "Happy Diwali" and "Paytm karo" in the night sky.

Sensex, Nifty snap 2-day rally as dull Q2 earnings disrupt momentum The BSE Sensex fell 0.5% to close at 79,966, while the NSE Nifty 50 index declined by the same margin to 24,350, as market sentiment weakened due to ongoing foreign selling and lacklustre corporate earnings.
StoxBox's Diwali picks: 5 stocks to light up your portfolioGet ready to brighten your portfolio this Diwali with these five promising stocks that are expected to deliver strong future performance.

Falling behind in AI race has cost Samsung $122 billion: Report Samsung has lost $122 billion in market value since July, a tumble of 32% that makes it the largest decline among global chipmakers this year.
Elcid's 66,92,535% surge makes it India's most expensive stock, surpassing MRFElcid Investments, based in Mumbai, is a non-banking financial company (NBFC) with a strong connection to Asian Paints.

Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports: Why Adani stocks are gaining todayAdani Enterprises shares rose 4.42% to Rs 2,974.50 on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) at 11:41 am, while APSEZ saw a 2.62% lift to Rs 1,408.65. All other Adani Group companies also traded in the green, supported by these positive cues.

RBI's 102-tonne gold haul this Dhanteras: What's behind the move?The RBI recently relocated 102 tonnes of gold from the Bank of England's vaults to secure facilities within India as it now hold a total of 855 tonnes in reserves.

Explained: Why Maruti Suzuki share price gained over 2% despite weak Q2 resultsMaruti Suzuki's quarterly report revealed a 17% year-on-year decline in net profit to Rs 3,103 crore, falling short of market expectations.

Sensex, Nifty in red as Q2 earnings dampen Diwali spirit; Adani stocks gainThe NSE Nifty 50 dropped 0.24% to 24,411.9 points, while the BSE Sensex declined 0.28% to 80,142.11 by 9:57 am. Seven out of the 13 major sectors showed losses, while small-cap and mid-cap indices performed better, rising 1% and 0.5%, respectively.

Afcons Infrastructure IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Afcons Infrastructure allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online. They can log in to either the BSE website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Afcons Infrastructure Day 3: Check latest subscription, GMP sees dip  The Afcons Infrastructure IPO comprises a fresh issue of 2.7 crore shares valued at Rs 1,250 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 9.03 crore shares worth Rs 4,180 crore.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Make poll promises you can keep: Congress chief raps Karnataka, cautions statesMallikarjun Kharge's remark came after the Congress-led Karnataka government said that it would review its 'Shakti' scheme that promises free bus rides to women.

I'm not your maal: Shaina NC slams rival Uddhav Sena MP's sexist remarkShiv Sena (UBT) MP Arvind Sawant stoked a controversy after he called Shaina NC "imported maal" after she quit the BJP and joined the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena faction ahead of the Maharashtra Assembly election.

Delhi declares public holiday on November 7 for Chhath Puja celebrationsDelhi Chief Minister Atishi has announced a public holiday on November 7 for Chhath Puja, which is an important festival for the Purvanchali community.

Decoding Delhi's Diwali data: How 24-hour average hides real-time pollution peaksA detailed analysis by the monitoring stations across Delhi revealed that night-time pollution levels on Diwali were alarmingly high, with PM2.5 and PM10 particles soaring up to 30 times the standard limit.

Singham Again review: Singham roars but Simmba gets biggest kill in cop universeReleased-Fri Nov 01, 2024Rohit Shetty reimagines the Ramayan in his cop universe with Ajay Devgn as Bajirao Singham, offering a blend of humour, drama, and action. The film features a contemporary twist on the mythological tale with a star-studded cast and meta jokes. Read the full review.

Nude Lovers spring back, remind India of first 'obscene' art controversyThe Bombay High Court in October prevented the customs department from destroying paintings of Akbar Padamsee over "obscenity". It was Padamsee's nude paintings, Lovers 1 and 2, which was Independent India's first major art controversy. Seventy years on, the nude Lovers have returned to public consciousness.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Bibek Debroy, economist and PM Modi's economic council chief, dies at 69Bibek Debroy, widely recognised for shaping economic policies, is also known for his translations of classical Sanskrit texts, including the Mahabharata and the Gita.

Odisha man kills wife with help of 2 girlfriends after she learns of his affairsThe matter came to light when the accused took his wife to a Bhubaneswar hospital, claiming that she had attempted suicide. However, the post-mortem report and police investigation saw all the three accused being arrested.

Sedition case against 18 Hindus in Bangladesh over saffron flagsEighteen Hindus have been booked for sedition in Bangladesh over saffron flags being raised in Chattogram. Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, one of the Hindu leaders facing the sedition case, spoke exclusively to India Today Digital on how this is part of an agenda of targeting minorities.

On Singham Again release day, a look at contemporary films that explored RamayanaRohit Shetty's Singham Again, released on November 1, incorporateed Ramayana themes amidst a star-studded cast. Digital arrest scam: How cybercriminals in Cambodia are defrauding IndiansSources in the Home Ministry's cyber wing said scammers were siphoning off approximately Rs 6 crore every day through digital arrest techniques. Southeast Asian countries such as Cambodia are the hotbed of these scams.

sports.headline: Manchester United confirm Ruben Amorim as new manager to replace Erik ten HagManchester United confirmed on November 1, Friday that they have made Ruben Amorim their new manager. Amorim will be taking over as United manager after they sacked Erik ten Hag after a poor start to the season.

Virat Kohli run-out suicidal, India cannot afford such collapses: Anil KumbleAnil Kumble has termed Virat Kohli's run-out on Day 1 of the Mumbai Test against New Zealand as 'suicidal'. India lost control after Kohli's dismissal, ending the day at 86 for 4, trailing by 149 runs.

On 24th birthday, India's Yastika Bhatia makes impressive WBBL debut WBBL 2024: India's Yastika Bhatia celebrated her 24th birthday with a handy knock for the Melbourne Stars in their match against Sydney Sixers on Friday at the North Sydney Oval.

Pat Cummins a doubt as Australia to tour Sri Lanka for 2 Tests and 1 ODIAustralia's cricket team is set to tour Sri Lanka in early 2025 for a series of two Tests and one ODI. Captain Pat Cummins might miss this tour as he expects the arrival of his second child.

Ruben Amorim remains tight-lipped on Manchester United links: Will talk about itSporting Lisbon's coach Ruben Amorim has chosen not to comment on speculations linking him to the Manchester United managerial position. Amorim is all set to replace Erik ten Hag as the new United manager, according to British media.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
